Mid-term Assessment

Guide to the mid-term assessment process for SRTP projects

ğŸš€ Mid-term Assessment Process

The mid-term assessment is a critical milestone for Innovation and Entrepreneurship Training Program projects. It typically occurs midway through the project timeline (usually at the end of the first year) and serves as a checkpoint to evaluate progress, identify challenges, and make necessary adjustments.

ğŸ“… Timeline

ğŸ“¢ Important Note: The specific dates may vary each year. Please refer to the latest notice on the Academic Affairs Office website: Academic Affairs Office Practice Notice

Reference timeline based on recent years:

  • ğŸ“ System Opening: Early December (e.g., December 5, 2023)
  • â° Student Submission Deadline: Late February of the following year (e.g., February 21, 2024)
  • ğŸ“‹ Faculty Advisor Review Deadline: Late February of the following year (e.g., February 25, 2024)
  • ğŸ‰ Department Review Deadline: Early March of the following year (e.g., March 10, 2024)

ğŸ’° Importance of Mid-term Assessment

The mid-term assessment serves several important purposes:

  1. Progress Evaluation: To assess whether the project is proceeding according to the original plan
  2. Quality Control: To ensure the quality of the research or entrepreneurial activities
  3. Problem Identification: To identify and address any challenges or obstacles
  4. Funding Release: To determine eligibility for the release of the second phase of funding (50% of the total)
  5. Project Adjustment: To provide an opportunity to adjust project goals or methodologies if necessary

âš ï¸ Special Reminder: Only projects that pass the mid-term assessment will receive the second phase of research funding!

ğŸ“‹ System Operation Guide

Step 1: System Login

  1. ğŸŒ Access the SRTP system: http://180.108.46.32:81/dglgxy_cx/
  2. ğŸ”‘ Log in using your student ID and password
  3. ğŸ“‹ Find the "Mid-term Assessment" option in the left menu

Step 2: Complete the Assessment Form

  1. ğŸ“ Project Basic Information

    • Project name
    • Project type (Innovation Training/Entrepreneurship Training/Entrepreneurship Practice)
    • Project level (University/Provincial/National)
    • Project leader
    • Faculty advisor

  2. ğŸ“Š Project Progress

    • Project research progress
    • Achievements obtained so far
    • Problems encountered during research and solutions
    • Next step work plan

  3. ğŸ’° Funding Usage

    • Amount of funding used
    • Detailed expenditure list
    • Explanation of the reasonableness of fund usage

  4. ğŸ¯ Expected Project Outcomes

    • Expected research results
    • Expected papers or patents
    • Expected competitions or exhibitions

Step 3: Submission and Review Process

  1. ğŸ“§ Student Submission

    • Complete system submission before the deadline
    • Ensure all materials are complete and accurate
    • Notify your faculty advisor to review after submission

  2. ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ« Faculty Advisor Review

    • Faculty advisor logs into the system to review
    • Provides review comments
    • Completes review before the deadline
    • Review content includes:
      • Project progress evaluation
      • Fund usage reasonableness evaluation
      • Suggestions for next steps

  3. ğŸ« Department Review

    • Department organizes expert review
    • Completes review before the deadline
    • Submits to Academic Affairs Office for record
    • Review content includes:
      • Overall project progress evaluation
      • Fund usage evaluation
      • Suggestions for future project development

ğŸ“‘ Preparation Requirements

1. Mid-term Report

Prepare a comprehensive mid-term report (typically 5-10 pages) that includes:

  • Project Overview: Brief summary of the project objectives and methodology
  • Progress Summary: Detailed account of work completed to date
  • Achievement Analysis: Comparison of actual achievements against planned milestones
  • Challenges and Solutions: Description of any problems encountered and how they were addressed
  • Financial Statement: Summary of expenditures to date with budget comparison
  • Adjusted Plan: If necessary, proposed adjustments to the original plan
  • Next Steps: Detailed plan for the remaining project period

2. Supporting Materials

Gather relevant supporting materials:

  • Research Data: Raw data, analysis results, experimental records
  • Project Outputs: Any preliminary publications, prototypes, or product designs
  • Financial Records: Receipts and records of all expenditures
  • Meeting Minutes: Documentation of team meetings and consultations with advisors
  • Media Materials: Photos, videos, or presentations related to the project

ğŸ¯ Evaluation Criteria

The mid-term assessment is evaluated based on:

  1. Progress Achievement (30%)

    • Completion of planned milestones
    • Adherence to timeline
    • Quality of work completed

  2. Scientific/Business Merit (25%)

    • Quality of research or business development
    • Innovation demonstrated
    • Potential impact

  3. Problem Solving (20%)

    • Identification and resolution of challenges
    • Adaptability and flexibility
    • Critical thinking

  4. Resource Management (15%)

    • Effective use of funding
    • Time management
    • Resource allocation

  5. Documentation Quality (10%)

    • Clarity and completeness of reports
    • Organization of materials
    • Professional presentation

âš ï¸ Possible Outcomes

The mid-term assessment can result in several outcomes:

  1. Pass: Project is progressing satisfactorily and can continue as planned

    • Second phase funding (50% of total) is released
    • Team can proceed with the next phase of the project

  2. Pass with Recommendations: Project is generally on track but needs minor adjustments

    • Second phase funding is released
    • Team must address specific recommendations
    • Follow-up report may be required

  3. Conditional Pass: Significant concerns exist but are considered addressable

    • Second phase funding may be partially released
    • Team must submit a revised plan within a specified timeframe
    • Additional review may be required

  4. Fail: Project shows serious problems that cannot be easily resolved

    • Second phase funding is not released
    • Project may be terminated or placed on probation
    • Team may be given one opportunity to submit a major revision

ğŸ’¡ Tips for a Successful Mid-term Assessment

  1. ğŸ“š Start Early: Begin preparing your materials well before the deadline
  2. ğŸ’¡ Be Honest: Acknowledge challenges or delays; evaluators value honesty
  3. ğŸ“Š Show Evidence: Provide concrete evidence of progress (data, prototypes, etc.)
  4. ğŸ”§ Address Problems: Demonstrate how you've overcome obstacles
  5. ğŸ“ Maintain Documentation: Keep detailed records throughout the project
  6. ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ« Consult Your Advisor: Get feedback on your report before submission
  7. ğŸ¯ Be Future-Focused: Clearly outline your plan for project completion
  8. â“ Prepare for Questions: Be ready to answer questions about your project

ğŸ“ Contact for Assistance

  • Academic Affairs Office Practice Section:
    • ğŸ“ Location: 1A208 of Administration Building, Songshan Lake Campus, Dongguan University of Technology
    • â˜ï¸ Phone: (0769) 22861099

Remember, successfully completing the mid-term assessment not only means securing funding for the next phase but also serves as an important validation of your project's progress. Good luck with your mid-term assessment! ğŸ“âœ¨
